sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A little booke of Iohn Caluines concernynge offences whereby at this daye diuers are feared, and many also quight withdrawen from the pure doctrine of the Gospell, a woorke very needefull and profitable. Translated out of Latine into Englishe by Arthur Goldinge. De scandalis. English Calvin, Jean, 1509-1564. Golding, Arthur, 1536-1606.
[12], 111, [1] leaves
By [H. Wykes for?] VVilliam Seres, dvvellyng at the weast ende of Powels, at the signe of the Hedghogge, [Imprinted at London : Anno Domini. 1567]
A translation of: De scandalis. Imprint from colophon; actual printer's name conjectured by STC. Running title reads: Iohn Caluine concerninge offences. Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
=======
